org.mokai.impl.camel
Class AbstractCamelConnectorService

java.lang.Object
  org.mokai.impl.camel.AbstractCamelConnectorService
All Implemented Interfaces:
ConnectorService, Service
Direct Known Subclasses:
CamelApplicationService, CamelConnectionService
public abstract class AbstractCamelConnectorService
extends Object
implements ConnectorService

ConnectorService implementation based on Apache Camel. Base class of CamelApplicationService and CamelConnectionService.

Author:
German Escobar

Constructor Detail

AbstractCamelConnectorService

public AbstractCamelConnectorService(String id,
                                     Connector connector,
                                     ResourceRegistry resourceRegistry)
                              throws IllegalArgumentException,
                                     ExecutionException

Constructor. Initializes the object with the received arguments. Modifies the id of the connector by removing spaces and lower casing it. Injects some resources to the connector: ResourceRegistry implementation, MessageProducer implementation and the ConnectorContext.

Notice that this constructor doesn't initialize the routes. See the start() method to see how the routes are initialized.

Parameters:
id - the id of the connector service. Shouldn't be null or empty.
connector - the Connector implementation
resourceRegistry - a populated ResourceRegistry implementation with at least the CamelContext and the RedeliveryPolicy, among other resources.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if the id, connector, ResourceRegistry or CamelContext are not provided..
ExecutionException - if an exception is thrown configuring the connector.
See Also:
start()

getId

public final String getId()
Specified by:
getId in interface ConnectorService
Returns:
the assigned id.

getPriority

public final int getPriority()
Description copied from interface: ConnectorService
The priority is used by the RoutingEngine to determine the order in which the connector services should be query in order to accept or reject a message. The priority only applies to connectors that implement the Processor interface.

Specified by:
getPriority in interface ConnectorService
Returns:
the priority of this connector service.

setPriority

public final void setPriority(int priority)
Description copied from interface: ConnectorService
Sets the priority. This value is used to determine the order in which the connector services should be query in order to accept or reject a message. The priority only applies to connectors that implement the Processor interface.

Specified by:
setPriority in interface ConnectorService
Parameters:
priority - can be a positive or negative number.

getMaxConcurrentMsgs

public int getMaxConcurrentMsgs()
Description copied from interface: ConnectorService
The maximum number of messages that can be processed concurrently by the connector. This only applies to connectors that implement the Processor interface.

Specified by:

public final ConnectorService addAcceptor(Acceptor acceptor)
                                   throws IllegalArgumentException,
                                          ObjectAlreadyExistsException,
                                          ExecutionException
Description copied from interface: ConnectorService
Adds an Acceptor to the collection of acceptors if it doesn't exists. Existence of an acceptor is determined by the Acceptor#equals(Object) method.

Returns:
the ConnectorService instance (fluent API).
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if the acceptor is null.
ObjectAlreadyExistsException - if the acceptor already exists.

getStatus

public final Monitorable.Status getStatus()
Description copied from interface: ConnectorService
The status tells whether the service is ok or not. The status is calculated by first checking the status of the Connector (if it implements Monitorable). If the connector implements then this method also checks if the last message failed or was successfully processed.

Specified by:
getStatus in interface ConnectorService
Returns:
the status of the connector service.
See Also:
Monitorable.Status

start

public final void start()
                 throws ExecutionException
Starts consuming messages from the queue (returned by AbstractCamelConnectorService#getQueueUri() method) and builds the Apache Camel routes to process and receive messages from the Processor. If the Processor implements Serviceable, it will call the Serviceable.doStart() method.

Specified by:
start in interface Service
Throws:
ExecutionException - wraps any exception thrown by the service while starting.

stop

public final void stop()
Starts consuming messages from the queue (returned by AbstractCamelConnectorService#getQueueUri() method) and stops the Apache Camel routes. If the Processor implements Serviceable, it calls the Serviceable.doStop() method.

Specified by:
stop in interface Service

destroy

public final void destroy()
Calls the stop() method. If the Processor implements Configurable, it calls the Configurable.destroy() method.

Specified by:
destroy in interface ConnectorService

public final String toString()
Overrides:
toString in class Object

getOutboundUriPrefix

protected abstract String getOutboundUriPrefix()
The outbound uri is the endpoint where messages are queued before they are processed by a Processor.

Returns:
a string with the outbound uri prefix.

getInboundUriPrefix

protected abstract String getInboundUriPrefix()
The inbound uri is the enpoint where messages are received from a MessageProducer) and handled by this connector service.

Returns:
a string with the inbound uri prefix.

getProcessedMessagesUri

protected abstract String getProcessedMessagesUri()
The processed messages uri is the enpoint where processed messages are queued before persisted.

Returns:
a string with a processed messages uri.

getFailedMessagesUri

protected abstract String getFailedMessagesUri()
The failed messages uri is the endpoint where failed messages are queued before persisted.

Returns:
a string with a failed messages uri.

getMessagesRouterUri

protected abstract String getMessagesRouterUri()
The messages router uri is the endpoint to which the received messages are routed.

Returns:
a string with the messages router uri.

getDirection

protected abstract Message.Direction getDirection()
Returns:
the direction that should be assigned to a received message.
